Links will become active as materials are released. Solutions are released immediately after the deadline, along with the next problem set.

<script>
(function() {
  function processPage() {
    // Fetch both timestamps and release manifest
    Promise.all([
      fetch('files/file_timestamps.json').then(r => r.ok ? r.json() : null).catch(() => null),
      fetch('files/release_manifest.json').then(r => r.ok ? r.json() : null).catch(() => null)
    ]).then(([timestampData, releaseData]) => {
      const files = timestampData?.files || {};
      const assignments = releaseData?.assignments || [];
      const timezone = releaseData?.timezone || 'America/New_York';

      // Build lookup by assignment ID
      const assignmentById = {};
      assignments.forEach(a => { assignmentById[a.id] = a; });

      // Get current time
      const now = new Date();

      // Helper: check if a date string has passed
      function hasDatePassed(isoString) {
        if (!isoString) return false;
        const date = new Date(isoString);
        return now >= date;
      }

      // Helper: disable a link (convert to plain text)
      function disableLink(link) {
        if (link.classList.contains('link-disabled')) return;
        link.classList.add('link-disabled');
        link.removeAttribute('href');
        link.style.pointerEvents = 'none';
      }

      // Helper: extract pset ID from href (e.g., "files/psets/pset1/pset1.pdf" -> "pset1")
      function extractPsetId(href) {
        const match = href.match(/psets\/(pset\d+)\//);
        return match ? match[1] : null;
      }

      // Helper function to add last-updated row to a table row
      function addLastUpdatedRow(row, labelText) {
        if (row.nextElementSibling && row.nextElementSibling.classList.contains('last-updated-row')) return;

        const cells = row.querySelectorAll('td');
        const timestamps = [];
        let hasAnyTimestamp = false;

        cells.forEach((cell, idx) => {
          if (idx === 0) {
            timestamps.push(labelText);
            return;
          }
          const link = cell.querySelector('a[href*="files/"]');
          if (link) {
            const href = link.getAttribute('href');
            if (!href) {
              timestamps.push('');
              return;
            }
            const path = href.replace(/^.*?(files\/)/, '$1');
            const timestamp = files[path];
            if (timestamp) {
              hasAnyTimestamp = true;
              const date = new Date(timestamp);
              const formatted = date.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
                month: 'short',
                day: 'numeric'
              });
              timestamps.push(formatted);
            } else {
              timestamps.push('');
            }
          } else {
            timestamps.push('');
          }
        });

        if (hasAnyTimestamp) {
          row.classList.add('has-updated-row');
          const newRow = document.createElement('tr');
          newRow.className = 'last-updated-row';
          timestamps.forEach((text, idx) => {
            const td = document.createElement('td');
            td.textContent = text;
            if (idx === 0) td.className = 'last-updated-label';
            else td.className = 'last-updated-date';
            newRow.appendChild(td);
          });
          row.parentNode.insertBefore(newRow, row.nextSibling);
        }
      }

      // Process problem sets table: disable unreleased links
      document.querySelectorAll('table').forEach(table => {
        const rows = Array.from(table.querySelectorAll('tbody tr'));
        const headerRow = table.querySelector('thead tr');
        const headers = headerRow ? Array.from(headerRow.querySelectorAll('th')).map(th => th.textContent.trim()) : [];

        // Check if this is the slides table
        const isSlidesTable = headers.includes('Topic') && headers.includes('PDF');
        // Check if this is the problem sets table
        const isPsetTable = headers.includes('Problem Set') && headers.includes('Questions');

        rows.forEach(row => {
          const firstCell = row.querySelector('td:first-child');
          if (!firstCell) return;

          // Problem sets table: check release status and disable unreleased links
          if (firstCell.textContent.includes('Problem Set')) {
            const cells = row.querySelectorAll('td');

            // Find the pset ID from any link in the row
            let psetId = null;
            cells.forEach(cell => {
              const link = cell.querySelector('a[href*="files/psets/"]');
              if (link && !psetId) {
                psetId = extractPsetId(link.getAttribute('href'));
              }
            });

            if (psetId) {
              const assignment = assignmentById[psetId];
              if (assignment) {
                const questionsReleased = hasDatePassed(assignment.pre_release_at_local);
                const solutionsReleased = hasDatePassed(assignment.sol_release_at_local);

                cells.forEach(cell => {
                  const link = cell.querySelector('a');
                  if (!link) return;
                  const href = link.getAttribute('href') || '';

                  // Questions and Source links: require questions release
                  if (href.includes('pset') && !href.includes('_solutions')) {
                    if (!questionsReleased) {
                      disableLink(link);
                    }
                  }
                  // Solutions link: require solutions release
                  if (href.includes('_solutions')) {
                    if (!solutionsReleased) {
                      disableLink(link);
                    }
                  }
                });
              }
            }

            // Add timestamp row (only for released items)
            addLastUpdatedRow(row, 'Last updated');
          }
          // Slides table
          else if (isSlidesTable) {
            addLastUpdatedRow(row, 'Last updated');
          }
        });
      });

      // Process other links (lecture notes) with inline dates
      document.querySelectorAll('a[href*="files/"]').forEach(link => {
        // Skip links in tables (they have row-based dates)
        if (link.closest('table')) return;

        if (link.nextSibling && link.nextSibling.className === 'file-updated') return;
        const href = link.getAttribute('href');
        if (!href) return;
        const path = href.replace(/^.*?(files\/)/, '$1');
        const timestamp = files[path];
        if (timestamp) {
          const date = new Date(timestamp);
          const formatted = date.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
            month: 'short',
            day: 'numeric'
          });
          const span = document.createElement('span');
          span.className = 'file-updated';
          // Use "last updated" for main lecture notes PDF, "upd." for chapters
          const isMainLectureNotes = href.includes('lecture_notes_ECON1550.pdf');
          span.textContent = isMainLectureNotes ? ` (last updated ${formatted})` : ` (upd. ${formatted})`;
          link.parentNode.insertBefore(span, link.nextSibling);
        }
      });
    }).catch(err => console.error('Materials page error:', err));
  }

  if (document.readyState === 'loading') {
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', processPage);
  } else {
    processPage();
  }
})();
</script>
